posts.content:
This is a rare to see build, a divine weapon's master wielding the most dreadful of weapons, pushing in additional damage throughout divine might and paladin buffs such as the holy sword spell. Taunt is there more as an icing on the cake, it's value is enough assuming you will have charisma as one of your two main stats. This is the balanced version presented here (i use a 30/ 18, stat split) but even this has more than enough power to pass through any defence. Remember to use your active defences and nobody will be able to touch you (divine shield + expertise gives you as much as +16 AC, +1 dodge) and use scrolls like death ward and freedom, you are a paladin after all.

Enjoy,

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
The only real problem you have with taking all 5 levels of Paladin pre-epic is that you lose your final Taunt dump. I don't know if Taunt is useful or not in Swordflight, but with your suggestion you'll have less than half the available ranks than you would have with the final level at 40.

The easiest way to get to Pally 3 earlier might be to replace Knockdown with Power Attack at level 1 and Blind Fight with Dodge at L3. You could then take either DS or DM at level 6. Knockdown and Blind Fight would be delayed to levels 12 and 15. That's assuming you move Pally 4 to level 18 and take the other of DS or DM then. You'll stay on track that way, just delaying some things a little.

It also means you'll still be able to get the 6 Great Strengths in, thus saving you from a "floating stat", as well as maxing your Taunt potential.

What do you think?
